content:
Course Code                                                      601: DSC 11, 12 , SEC-4
          Course Title                                                                      Project
                Credit                                                                           18
     Teaching per Week                                     24 hours (i.e. 2 Students / hour / Week)
     Minimum weeks per       15 (Project work, Self-Study, examination, preparation, holidays etc.)
              Semester                                                                          NaN
Last Review / Revision                                                                          ---
     Purpose of Course Students will get trained in industrial practices and activities of Software
                   NaN                                                                  Engineering
      Course Objective        To expose students to industrial practices and activities of software
                   NaN                                   engineering and train them about the same.
          Pr-requisite             Knowledge of Advanced Programming, Latest Technologies and Tools
                   NaN                                                    and Software Engineering.
       Course Out come        After completion of this course, the student will be capable to start
                   NaN         professional career and/or research work in the field of Information
                   NaN                                                                  Technology.
        Course Content  Entire semester is allocated for a full-time project work. All the students
                   NaN           have to undergo a project preferably in an industry or any reputed
                   NaN       institute. The students must prepare documentation of the project work
                   NaN           done as per the software Engineering Guidelines. At the end of the
                   NaN        semester, the students have to submit their project report in bounded
                   NaN      form to the respective institution. The project presentation and viva –
                   NaN                                  voice will be conducted on the basis of it.
                   NaN        The students have to submit the following reports to their respective
                   NaN                                                                 institution:
                   NaN                                                    1. Project Joining Report
                   NaN                                           2. Appropriate name of the project
                   NaN                 3. Monthly Progress Report duly sign by the concern external
                   NaN                                                                        guide
                   NaN                                            4. Project Completion Certificate
                   NaN                                           5. Institution/College Certificate
                   NaN      6. Software Coding declaration (if industry/organization doesn’t permit
                   NaN         students to submit the source code) ( To be submitted at the time of
                   NaN                                                    joining project training)
                   NaN                                                         7. Attendance Report
                   NaN        Without such reports student will not be allowed to appear in his/her
                   NaN                                   final Project Presentation and Viva-Voice.
                   NaN                                                                          NaN
  Teaching Methodology                                                     Project guidance, review
                   NaN                                                                          NaN
     Evaluation Method              70% Internal assessment is based on project presentation and/or
                   NaN                                    demonstration and viva-voice examination.
                   NaN        30% assessment is based Project Presentation and/or demonstration and
                   NaN                               viva-voice examination at the end of semester.

Course Code                                                                  602  DSE-6
          Course Title                     Seminar Presentation/Review of published research paper
                Credit                                                                           2
     Teaching per Week                                     2 hours (i.e. 2 Students / hour / Week)
     Minimum weeks per      15 (Project work, Self-Study, examination, preparation, holidays etc.)
              Semester                                                                         NaN
Last Review / Revision                                                                         ---
     Purpose of Course             The purpose of the course is to make student capable of gaining
                   NaN    additional knowledge (besides the curricula) in the field of information
                   NaN                 technology by self learning practices and presenting and/or
                   NaN                                                           demonstrating it.
                   NaN                                                                          OR
                   NaN    The purpose of a review paper is to succinctly review recent progress in
                   NaN      a particular topic. Overall, the paper summarizes the current state of
                   NaN    knowledge of the topic. It creates an understanding of the topic for the
                   NaN       reader by discussing the findings presented in recent research papers
      Course Objective        Additional knowledge building in the field of Information Technology
                   NaN                    using self-learning practice and research paper reviews.
          Pr-requisite                         Basic Knowledge of Information Technology theories,
                   NaN                                     activities, methods, techniques & tools
       Course Out come       After completion of this course, the student will have gained further
                   NaN    knowledge (besides the curricula) in the field of information technology
                   NaN         by self learning practices and will be capable of presenting and/or
                   NaN                                                           demonstrating it.
                   NaN                                                                          OR
                   NaN                        The student will benefit with research paper reviews
                   NaN                                To help improve writing and research skills
                   NaN                                To professionalize the graduate experience.
                   NaN                                             To inform a future career path
        Course Content In this paper students will have to select any topic related to information
                   NaN                technology field– preferably based on the current trends and
                   NaN   technologies for the seminar. Individual student is required to prepare a
                   NaN    seminar report. At the end of the semester student has to submit seminar
                   NaN            report with satisfactory detail study in the bounded form to the
                   NaN     respective institution. The seminar presentation and viva voice will be
                   NaN        conducted on the basis of selected topic at the end of the semester.
                   NaN     The students have to submit the following documents to their respective
                   NaN                                                                institution:
                   NaN                                 1. Name and abstract of the Topic selected.
                   NaN        2. Monthly Progress Report duly signed by the concern internal guide
                   NaN                            3. Work Completion Certificate by internal guide
                   NaN                                          4. Institution/College Certificate
  Teaching Methodology                                                    Seminar guidance, review
                   NaN                                                                         NaN
     Evaluation Method             70% Internal assessment is based on seminar presentation and/or
                   NaN                                   demonstration and viva-voice examination.
                   NaN       30% assessment is based seminar Presentation and/or demonstration and
                   NaN                              viva-voice examination at the end of semester.
